fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10639].
  {panel}

I am not sure this is a feature or a bug.
I have a project with multiple components. Some issues belong to more than one component.
If I filter on component x and component y I want the issues having x AND y, instead I get all issues having x OR y. 
And I am not able to use the search expression.
fields.summary: Filter on multiple components produces 'OR' result while I expect 'AND' result

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10638].
  {panel}

JRA-10205 was reported regarding the displaying of issue summary, reported and assignee, type and status on certain issue operations when not logged in. For 3.6.3 the solutions was to simply throw an IssuePermissionException when the user doesn't have Browse Issue permission for that issue. Please see that issue for a description of how it was done and what files were touched.

However, it was noted that there were at least four different ways the Issue actions might report this to the user.
# Custom handling in the operation view. Creates a very nice error page with the operation, and friendly error message - http://server/jira/secure/AddComment!default.jspa?id=12345
# "You are not logged in" message with standard Jira banner, user gets redirected to permission-violation page (permissionviolation.jsp), not so friendly, but the user gets the point - http://server/jira/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?id=12345 (note, this page has trackback info)
# "Access Denied" message with big red background, user gets redirected to security-breach page (securitybreach.jsp) with standard Jira banner, not so friendly big red message, user still gets the point - http://server/jira/secure/attachment/12345/logs_jira-int_11_03_2005.txt or the ViewVoters or ManageWatchers urls (no trackback info). 
# 500 page catches IssuePermissionException, very, very unfriendly message, lots of nasty logging.

{note}all the Admin pages use the securitybreach.jsp{note}

These need to be standardised so all access denied reports are the same, and it is not possible to view any secure information if you do not have that permission.

While researching JRA-10205 the following was noted:
- IssuePermissionException is handled inconsistently. We need to either throw it from our Action.doValidate(), Action.doExecute() & Action.doDefault() methods or handle it in a consistent manner.
- We probably should handle the standard case in the framework. AbstractIssueSelectAction holds the issueObject, and should be able to handle 99% of the code paths. Attached is a version that does the 99% (doesn't handle the trackback case)
- We could further generify the issue handling of Actions by having them implement some kind of IssueAware interface and have an interceptor of the filter stack read the request parameters and insert the Issue into the action. This could also have a PermissionException injector method as well if the user cannot see an issue. (Please ask Scott for further information, as this is his idea).
- The trackback info is the wrinkle edge-case, we do actually have to provide some issue info in the trackback rdf if enabled.

Final caveat: The permission error page actually DOES HAVE TO HAVE the issue summary in it (if incoming trackbacks are turned on) in the trackback RDF. This currently works if the permissionviolation.jsp is the result (which it is for ViewIssue). We probably need to have a separate TrackbackIssueInfo object that the Issue can give us that is filtered through a trackback policy filter. Then we can have a trackback policy for enabling/disabling trackbacks based on their security (for instance allow trackbacks for public issues only, rinse issue summary from non public issues etc.)

  {panel}

Hi there,

You may already have done this, but it would be great if we could filter out, in the listing of jobs, any that are a linked child of a higher level job (i.e. so that we can summarise up to the 5-10 key jobs in each version upgrade, rather than looking at 50-100 individual jobs).

Let me know if we can do this with the current version of JIRA we have, or any upgrades already released, or any upgrade to Pro or Enterprise.

If not, please schedule for a future release.

Thanks

Paul

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10507].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

*Original request description*
 
I use the project components very heavily for issue list filtering and rely on them for building out lists in Confluence using the {jiraissue} macro.
 
In order to preserve those lists, I have to keep the component around, unfortunately, many times I don't necessarily need it for future work. So I don't want to present the developers with the component if it doesn't really apply to work anymore.
 
It would be great if there was a mechanism to "archive" components just like you would with a release version, such that the user can no longer select that component for issues.
fields.summary: Archive project components
XML RPC Python client unable to retrieve an issue that has been moved

Did several changes to permission schemes and now have the system in a state where the browse users widget is disabled when logged-in as user with full privileges.   

Default permission scheme still exists, but I added two others.

On Bulk Edit Group Members page, a mouse-over of the browse-users icon (right side of page) gives tooltip that says "you do not have permission to browse users".    However I can assign users to the group if I know their userid and type it into the text field, I just cannot browse the list of possible users with the widget.

I am logged in as user who is member of jira-administrators group and this group as all privileges assigned.

With the same login, I can go to the User Browser page and assign users and groups without a problem.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit Group Members checks for 'Browse User' permission but User Browser doesn't

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10462].
  {panel}

A neat plugin would be a Custom Field that every time a value is stored it creates an entry in jiraactions.
You could add this to a transition screen.  
Every time it is saved, an entry is made into the {{jiraaction}} table.

This custom field would then need a counterpart Issue Tab plugin.  this would display each value stored, along with time stamp and author.

E.g. when you resolve an issue, there is custom field called - {{Resolution Notes}}.  This is blank (or a template is used from default value).
The person making the transition can then enter in the resolution notes.
When they then view the issue, there will be another tab that displays all the resolution notes.


Wouldn't be too hard to do either.
fields.summary: Custom Field whose values get displayed in issue tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10455].
  {panel}

It would be nice to able to create a separate web application with a separate data model, offering whatever functionality is desired such as contacts management, SLA management or whatever.

And then create a custom field in Jira which has a drop down selector tied to a column in an SQL table belonging to that application. So when in Jira you can open a selector and choose one of the records in the external application.

For instance when creating an issue you could select a customer, which lives in a separate application. Or you could choose an SLA agreement.

The Custom field would need to be configured with the SQL table name, the SQL column name containing a unique identified and the SQL column name containing a human readable description of the row. For additional flexibility you may need to configure a database connection so you can connect to an external database.
fields.summary: Custom SQL field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10383].
  {panel}


If the backup directory does not exist, the backup service fails. Even though there is a warning in JIRA's log file, I don't find this sufficient for such an important functionality.

I would suggest the following important improvement:
Make Jira create the directory if it does not exist. 
If unable to create the directory, generate an email warning to the jira administrators in order to have the problem identified and fixed.

As everybody knows, having a backup may be crucial for if you experience a harddrive failure........

I found a quite similar request JRA-7912 where another backup failure is discussed, though I want to adress the directory problem specifically as this can be easily fixed (simply creating the directory will in most cases fix the problem).
fields.summary: Backup service fails if backup directory does not exist
Workflow transition screens: allow definition of mandatory fields, defaults and descriptions here as well

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10364].
  {panel}

To assist with many different use cases, most noteably, allowing all users from a single customer to be able to easily sign up to JIRA and then see and comment on all the issues created by the colleagues we need: 'Dynamic Groups'.

The Dynamic Group will allow one or multiple domain names to be associated with it.

E.G. A JIRA Administrator wants to ensure that any users from their customer Domain that sign up to JIRA are automatically included in a group that has been setup for the company Domain which has permissions to view certain issues and projects. To do this:

1. A Dynamic Group called 'Domain' would be setup with two domains defined: domain.com, sub.domain.com.  

2. Then when a user signs up to JIRA, if their email address features domain.com or sub.domain.com they will automatically be added to the 'Domain' group. 

3. All Domain employees that sign up to JIRA will therefore automatically be allowed to see all Domain accessible JIRA content (dictated by Permissions and Issue Security Levels which refer to the group Domain).
fields.summary: Create dynamic groups - groups that automatically add users based on domain name of user's email address
Diagramatic representation of Jira data model should be included in documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10361].
  {panel}

Occasionally it would convenient to point casual users to JIRA to create issues, but the one doesn't want to surrounding complexity of JIRA to distract users. Irrelevant complexity might include:
 - Project and Issue type - these would probably be preselected for users.
 - Standard JIRA headers and menus. Eg. the 'Home' and 'Find Issues' tabs at the top. We want users to see _only_ things relevant to creating an issue.
 - JIRA user registration. It should be possible for users to enter just their name/email address, and optionally their password, entered in the same form that the issue is created in.
 - Custom 'thankyou' screen after issue creation. After creating the issue, it should be possible to send users to a custom screen, rather than dumping them back in the standard JIRA interface.
fields.summary: Support for simplified custom issue creation screens
Confluence integration: Link to user profile in Confluence

fields.description:
The following classes need to be converted to use the ProjectComponent object:

* SelectComponentAssignees
* ComponentAssigneeTypes
* SelectComponentAssigneesUtil

This will also require changing the associated Jelly tag - SelectComponentAssignees - to accommodate the new ProjectComponent object.

Also migrate the ComponentUtils class to use the ProjectComponent object and look to moving the various assignable check methods to the service.

DefaultAssigneeResolver needs to be converted to use ProjectComponents also.
fields.summary: Convert ComponentAssigneeTypes to use ProjectComponentService

fields.description:
In order to comlete this task - the following steps should be followed:

Within ComponentSystemField:

# migrate usages of ProjectManager to use the ProjectComponentManager (used to retrieve the components)
# Migrate component GV references to ProjectComponent objects
# The previous change will involve migrating the Issue object to user ProjectComponent objects also - ensure all clients of the Issue interface are also converted to use ProjectComponent objects when the IssueImpl.getComponents(...) method is called.
# Ensure that the vaious velocity templates (e.g. components-editvm) work correctly
fields.summary: Convert ComponentSystemField to use ProjectComponentManager and use ProjectComponent objects.
Ability to define fields and state on a move operation screen

fields.description:
In order to complete this task:

* AddComponent (Web Action)
## Migrate the methods getExistingEntityByName() and getProjectEntities() to use the ProjectComponent object.
## The equivalent Jelly method simply uses the AddComponent web action.
## No equivalent method within XML/RPC or SOAP.

* EditComponent (Web Action)
## This should be moved away from the EditProjectEntity interface - as the entity is now a ProjectComponent object
## Migrate all the methods to use the service and the ProjectComponent object.
## Remove the back-end action ComponentEdit and perform the edit through the service.
## No equivalent method within Jelly, XML/RPC or SOAP.

* DeleteComponent (Web Action)
## This should be moved away from the DeleteProjectEntity interface - as the entity is now a ProjectComponent object
## Move the swapComponent logic to the service.
## Migrate all the methods to use the service and the ProjectComponent object.
## Remove the back-end action ComponentDelete and perform the deletion through the service.
## No equivalent method within Jelly, XML/RPC or SOAP.

* ViewProject
## Migrate the components.jsp to use the ProjectComponentManager
fields.summary: Migrate all ProjectComponent Actions (Add/View/Edit/Remove) to use ProjectComponent object

fields.description:
In order to complete this task - the following steps should be taken:

# ProjectServiceImpl.getComponents(...) should be changed to use the ProjectComponentService to retrieve the components.
# Convert SoapUtils.getComponents(...) to take a ProjectComponent object and convert to a RemoteComponent. This will entail adding a constructor to RemoteComponent that sets the ID and name as determined from the ProjectComponent object.
# Test it!
fields.summary: Modify XML/RPC for Components to use the ProjectComponentService

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10333].
  {panel}

We have extended yours jira-rpc-plugin with possibility to   retrieving issue change history (see: http://jira.atlassian.com/  browse/JRA-9533) and because of that I have a question. It is   possible to include our changes in offical plugin release? It   will be a great benefit for possible customers not to install our   custom version of this plugin, but the original one. If it will   be possible, could you please contact me with a person to whom I   may send plugin source code changes. 

Best Regards,
Robert Sermak
Parasoft Corp.
www.parasoft.com

Hi Robert,

Thanks for offering to contribute! Just send your changes to me,   and I'll forward them on to the JIRA team so that they can look   over them. Hopefully we'll be able  to get them into the RPC   plugin soon. 

Cheers,
Jonathan


Hello Jonathan,

As I promised in attachment you can find changed version of rpc-  plugin and diff file. So, now with this changes new method is available in soap   interface: getChangeHistory, also two new beans has been introduced: RemoteChangeHistory and   RemoteChangeItem (take a look below for full list of changes or to attached diff file). Sad information   is that I've made only necessary changes from our point of view.   So, I did not add any unit tests and I did not change any part of   code responsible for xml-rpc. There is one thing more, because I   did not write any Jira plugin before, and I do not know Jira code very well I strongly recommend that someone   should review my changes before including them in main branch. Especially  I'm not sure  if   I have included all necessary fields in RemoteChangeHistory and in RemoteChangeItem bean. 

Finally, we'd really appreciate if someone let us know (if it is   not a problem of course) when we may expect official plugin   release. Thank you very much for all. 

Best Regards,
Robert Sermak
Parasoft Corp.
www.parasoft.com
fields.summary: Review and integrate contributed RPC changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10280].
  {panel}

This improvement relates to the default pale yellow colour that JIRA uses to highlight every other colour in a table of many rows.
The current pale yellow colour that JIRA uses by default is OK on some screens but on many other screens it is too pale to be distinct compared to the default "white" colour that is used for every other row.

=====================
PROPOSED SOLUTION:
=====================
Look & Feel > Colours > add another user choice called "Every Other Row Colour".
This would be useful because this colour needs to be user configurable.
The current pale yellow colour that JIRA uses by default is OK on some screens but on many other screens it is too pale to be visually different compared to the default "white" colour that is used for every other row.
Therefore, would be great if the user could specify the colour used for "Every Other Row Colour"
fields.summary: Add another colour user option under:    "Look & Feel"   >   "Colours"  >  "Every Other Row Colour"

fields.description:
If you've ever had the need to rearrange the order of subtasks, you know how painful this can be. Lots and lots of page reloads...one for each position you want it to move. I just finished moving a 10th item in a subtask list to the 2nd; stepping through *8* screens to accomplish that goal took about 3 minutes. Ugh.

Seems like the perfect opportunity for some AJAX order arrangement.

fields.description:
It would be nice if it was possible to attach multiple files in one go. A java applet could be a good solution where you are able to browse the local computer and select multiple files to upload.
A nice extra feature would be to have an option to zip all the files together or keep them as seperate files.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10156].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 3rd January 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,

Thanks for your votes and comments on this feature request. 

Due to resources and priorities at this time we have no immediate plans to improve our export issue to MS Word feature. We understand that this will disappoint a few of you needing this the most. If you are not using our OnDemand you might find this [commercial third party plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.xpandit.plugins.jiraxporter] as a satisfactory work around.  

While we will not be addressing this particular feature request in the near future, we plan to resolve several other requests as we have done in our past releases.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,
Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Management
roy (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description:*

When an issue with an image attached is exported to Word, the image doesn't show up in the Word document. This includes the Print option as well.
Tried with a JPG attachment, not other formats.
Opening the exported document in Word 2003 and OpenOffice.org 2.0 both results in a document without images, only the /images/icons/attach/image.gif placeholder + filename is shown.
They aren't even hyperlinked
fields.summary: Export issue to Word doesn't export images
"Unresolveable" Versions
Move components into their own manager

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10149].
  {panel}

It would be nice and useful if the number of versions shown in the RoadMap or ChangeLog was configurable and navigatable.
We have projects that have quite a lot versions that can't be archived and must be shown in the version selectors, roadmaps and changelogs.
Up to now there are only two options when browsing the changelog and roadmap: *next 3 versions* and *all versions*.
If you have lots of versions (lets say 20) the roadmap/changelog gets slow and long and not very usable (in means of usability)

Thus I'd like to see a page naviagor (just as with long issue navigator pages) like _<<_ *1*_|2|3 >>_ to switch forward and back trough the roadmap/changelog
fields.summary: Number of Versions shown in RoadMap and ChangeLog

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10114].

Currently we have:
 - UpdateIssueFieldFunction which can set an issue's assignee to a certain user
 - AssignToLeadFunction
 - AssignToReporterFunction

and there's a proposal for an "assign to current user" function (JRA-5819).

It seems silly having all these slightly different post-functions. We should enhance UpdateIssueFieldFunction to list "Current assignee", "project lead", "component lead" and "reporter".

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10045].

Whilst looking through the HTML of JIRA, there seems to be a lot of inline javascript (and styles) that could be moved into javascript include files.

A few examples that I came across:
- luckysearch()
- showtooltip()
- showcomment / hidecomment()

There are probably more.  Moving these out into include files would reduce the amount of HTML that is shown.
fields.summary: Remove inline javascript from pages
Add an improvement to workflow to allow multiple users to approve an issue in any order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10033].
  {panel}

The addComment method appears to work for most comment content, but not URLs.  I've been trying to determine why, but I just don't have enough information about how this works.  

If I include a comment:
---SNIP---
This is a link to:
slashdot.org
---SNIP---

JIRA adds this fine, but if I include a comment:
---SNIP---
This is a link to:
http://slashdot.org
---SNIP---

JIRA returns a 500 with the following fault information:
---SNIP---
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"><soapenv:Body><soapenv:Fault><faultcode>soapenv:Server.userException</faultcode><faultstring>org.apache.axis.types.URI$MalformedURIException: The scheme is not conformant.</faultstring><detail><faultData xsi:type="ns1:URI$MalformedURIException" xmlns:ns1="http://types.axis.apache.org"/><ns2:hostname xmlns:ns2="http://xml.apache.org/axis/">[internal hostname removed]</ns2:hostname></detail></soapenv:Fault></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>
---SNIP---

It is an xs:string field, so I don't understand why having a URL scheme in the content makes any difference.  If I had a full stack trace and the code I'd look it up myself, but I don't even see a stack trace in any of the jira logs on the filesystem.

I'd like to have the fully-qualified URL in the comment so users can click on it, but I don't know how to make it work.  I tried wrapping it in [CDATA[]], but that was no help.  I tried URL-encoding it, but it was not URL-unencoded on the other end.  I'm out of ideas.
fields.summary: SOAP addComment method does not accept URLs using SOAP::Lite

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-10015].
  {panel}

You have an issue and in time there are let's say 5 duplicates.
You see all these issues in the lists and managing them all can be a bit frustrating.
Maybe we need a merge button so we can merge the duplicate(s) with the original and close the duplicate(s) all with one click

If I say merge then you automagically think of a split issue option to. (create 2 or more subtasks for the original issue with some sort of split wizard)
fields.summary: Merge and split issues
Windows: Investigate redirecting output of Tomcat
Add help icon to Workflow Admin page
